website_summaries.verdict: A popular pizzelle maker of exceptional craftsmanship. Capable of quickly producing attractive, crispy pizzelles.
pros: Users can make numerous crispy, high ribbed pizzelles in a short amount of time
cons: Surface can get a bit sticky, requiring extra oil

customer_reviews.title: Just used it for the first time and was very pleased with ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Received as early Christmas gift from my husband. Just used it for the first time and was very pleased with ease of use! After 'preheating' I brushed top and bottom plates with oil, dropped the first 2 dollops of batter just above center, closed the Maker, clipped the handles together, and listened. When the sizzling steam calmed, it was time to open the Maker and remove the treats. No issues with sticking or burning. Now for a cup of tea! Note: For clean-up, I simply closed the hot irons on a very wet cloth for a few short seconds then left it to cool.
customer_reviews.author: wvanwoerkom

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA and Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I decided to learn how to make my favoriate cookie to drink with my afternoon tea. This machine made my adventure in pizzelle making a real joy. customer_reviews.title: Overcoming a tragic loss.
customer_reviews.text: For over 40 years I've had a "Dolce" brand pizzelle maker. It finally gave up the ghost (may it rest in peace). I bought this because in the pictures it looked most like my Dolce. Differences? No lights. The two pizzelles have the identical design (they are reversed with the "star" up on one side and down on the other, so it took awhile to notice that. After 4 dozen pizzelle, I love it. It works perfectly. The handle is sturdier than on my old one, and the latch on the handle makes for a consistent and thin cookie. I used a timer and cooked for 30 seconds, which seemed perfect. Thank you, Palmer.
